1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 from CartesianPositionController import CartesianPositionController
4 import numpy as np
5 import rospy
6 import tf
7 from ros_robotic_skin.msg import PointArray
8 
9 NUMBER_OF_CONTROL_POINTS = 7
10 
11 # Parameters of the flacco paper
12 MAX_RATE = 1.0 # Obstacle velocity estimation equation
13 ALPHA = 6.0
14 C = 5.0
15 RHO = 0.4
16 V_MAX = 0.21
17 Q_DOT_MIN = np.array([-2.1750, -2.1750, -2.1750, -2.1750, -2.6100, -2.6100, -2.6100])
18 Q_DOT_MAX = np.array([+2.1750, +2.1750, +2.1750, +2.1750, +2.6100, +2.6100, +2.6100])
19 
20 
21 class ObstacleAvoidanceController(CartesianPositionController):
22  def __init__(self):
23  super(ObstacleAvoidanceController, self).__init__()
24  self.control_points = []
25  self.obstacle_points = [np.array([5.00, 5.00, 5.00])]
26  self.Vi = np.zeros(3)
27  self.sphere_radiuses = (0.23, 0.24, 0.2, 0.237, 0.225, 0.20, 0.27)
28  rospy.Subscriber("live_points", PointArray, self.CallbackLivePoints)
29 
30  def CallbackLivePoints(self, msg):
31  self.obstacle_points = []
32  for i in range(len(msg.points)):
33  self.obstacle_points.append(np.array([msg.points[i].x, msg.points[i].y, msg.points[i].z]))
34  # self.obstacle_points = np.array([[0.8, 0, 0.3]])
35 
36  def get_control_points(self):
37  """
38  Updates the location of the end_effector in self.position.
39  Updates the location of the control points in self.control_points.
40  """
41  self.control_points = []
42  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
43  try:
44  (trans, rot) = self.tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'end_effector', rospy.Time(0))
45  self.position = np.array(trans)
46  for i in range(NUMBER_OF_CONTROL_POINTS):
47  (trans, rot) = self.tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'control_point{}'.format(i), rospy.Time(0))
48  self.control_points.append(np.array(trans))
49  break
50 
51  except (tf.LookupException,
52  tf.ConnectivityException,
53  tf.ExtrapolationException):
54  continue
55 
56  def get_distance_vectors_end_effector(self):
57  """
58  Get distance vectors that go from obstacle points to the end effector
59 
60  Returns
61  -------
62  d_vectors: list
63  List of np.ndarray s, as many as obstacle points there are
64  """
65  return [(self.obstacle_points[j] - self.position) for j in range(len(self.obstacle_points))]
66 
67  def get_distance_vectors_body(self):
68  """
69  Get distance vectors that go from obstacle points to control points
70 
71  Returns
72  -------
73  D_vectors: list
74  List of lists that contain np.ndarrays, as many as obstacle points there are
75  """
76  D_matrix = []
77  for i in range(NUMBER_OF_CONTROL_POINTS):
78  D_matrix.append([(self.obstacle_points[j] - self.control_points[i]) for j in range(len(self.obstacle_points))])
79  return D_matrix
80 
81  def get_repulsive_vector(self):
82  """
83  Repulsive vector algorithm (Only distance information)
84 
85  Returns
86  -------
87  max_repulse_vector: np.ndarray
88  Repulsive vector that the algorithm computes having into account obstacle data
89  """
90  Ds = self.get_distance_vectors_end_effector()
91  if Ds:
92  D = self.search_smallest_vector(Ds)
93  magnitude = V_MAX * (1 / (1 + np.exp(((np.linalg.norm(D)) * (2 / RHO) - 1) * ALPHA)))
94  unitary_vector = D/np.linalg.norm(D)
95  return magnitude * unitary_vector
96  else:
97  return np.zeros(3)
98 
99  def search_smallest_vector(self, vectors_list):
100  """
101  Algorithm that takes a list of vectors and returns the smallest
102 
103  Parameters
104  ----------
105  vectors_list : list
106  List of np.ndarrays
107 
108  Returns
109  -------
110  vectors_list[i]: np.ndarray
111  The smallest vector in vectors_list
112  """
113  norms = [np.linalg.norm(v) for v in vectors_list]
114  return vectors_list[norms.index(min(norms))]
115 
116  def select_most_restrictive(self, q_dot_max_list, q_dot_min_list):
117  """
118  This function gets a list of restriction vectors and returns the most restrictive combination
119 
120  Parameters
121  ----------
122  q_dot_max_list : list
123  list of restriction vectors
124  q_dot_min_list : list
125  list of restriction vectors
126 
127  Returns
128  -------
129  q_dot_min: np.ndarray
130  restriction vector
131  q_dot_max: np.ndarray
132  restriction vectors
133  """
134 
135  q_dot_max = np.array(Q_DOT_MAX)
136  q_dot_min = np.array(Q_DOT_MIN)
137  for i in range(7):
138  max_values = [vector[i] for vector in q_dot_max_list]
139  min_values = [vector[i] for vector in q_dot_min_list]
140  q_dot_max[i] = min(max_values)
141  q_dot_min[i] = max(min_values)
142  return (q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
143 
144  def apply_restrictions(self, q_dot_min, q_dot_max):
145  """
146  Applies the restrictions contained in q_dot_min and q_dot_max to self.q_dot member of the controller
147 
148  Parameters
149  ----------
150  q_dot_min : [type]
151  [description]
152  q_dot_max : [type]
153  [description]
154  """
155  # print('Before: {}'.format(np.array(self.q_dot)))
156  for i in range(7):
157  if self.q_dot[i] > q_dot_max[i]:
158  self.q_dot[i] = q_dot_max[i]
159  elif self.q_dot[i] < q_dot_min[i]:
160  self.q_dot[i] = q_dot_min[i]
161  # print('After: {}'.format(np.array(self.q_dot)))
162  # print("---------------")
163 
164  def end_effector_algorithm(self, xd_dot):
165  """
166  Algorithm that modifies the end effector velocity with the repulsive vectors, that depend on the obstacles sensed
167 
168  Parameters
169  ----------
170  xd_dot : np.ndarray
171  6x1 desired end effector velocity vector
172 
173  Returns
174  -------
175  xc_dot : np.ndarray
176  6x1 modified end effector velocity vector (Modified with obstacle information)
177  """
178  repulsive_vector = np.block([self.get_repulsive_vector(), np.array([0, 0, 0])])
179  repulsive_vector.shape = (6, 1)
180 
181  return xd_dot - repulsive_vector
182 
183  def body_algorithm(self):
184  """
185  Algorithm that computes the restrictions to joint velocities depending on obstacles data.
186 
187  Returns
188  -------
189  q_dot_min: np.ndarray
190  restriction vector
191  q_dot_max: np.ndarray
192  restriction vectors
193  """
194 
195  q_dot_max_list = []
196  q_dot_min_list = []
197 
198  for (i, distances_control_point_i) in enumerate(self.get_distance_vectors_body()):
199  if distances_control_point_i:
200  smallest_distance = self.search_smallest_vector(distances_control_point_i)
201  else:
202  return (np.array(Q_DOT_MIN), np.array(Q_DOT_MAX))
203  distance_norm = np.linalg.norm(smallest_distance) - self.sphere_radiuses[i]
204  unitary_vector = smallest_distance / distance_norm
205  f = 1 / (1 + np.exp((distance_norm * 2 / RHO - 1) * ALPHA))
206 
207  Jacobian_message = self.get_jacobian(self.q, 'control_point{}'.format(i))
208  J = np.array(Jacobian_message.J.J)
209  J.shape = (Jacobian_message.J.rows, Jacobian_message.J.columns)
210 
211  s = np.dot(np.linalg.pinv(J)[:, :3], unitary_vector) * f
212  q_dot_max_i = np.array(Q_DOT_MAX)
213  q_dot_min_i = np.array(Q_DOT_MIN)
214  for i in range(len(s)):
215  if s[i] >= 0:
216  q_dot_max_i[i] = Q_DOT_MAX[i] * (1 - f)
217  else:
218  q_dot_min_i[i] = Q_DOT_MIN[i] * (1 - f)
219  q_dot_max_list = q_dot_max_list + [q_dot_max_i]
220  q_dot_min_list = q_dot_min_list + [q_dot_min_i]
221 
222  (q_dot_min, q_dot_max) = self.select_most_restrictive(q_dot_max_list, q_dot_min_list)
223 
224  return (q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
225 
226  def go_to_point(self, position_desired):
227  """
228  Main function. Move to a point an stop when arrived
229 
230  Parameters
231  ----------
232  position_desired : numpy.ndarray
233  3x1 end effector desired position vector
234  Only position, not orientation
235  """
236  position_desired = np.array(position_desired)
237  self.error = position_desired - self.position
238  while np.linalg.norm(self.error) > self.error_threshold:
239  # Update lists
240  self.get_control_points()
241  # Obtained the desired end effector velocity, in the case there were no obstacles
242  xd_dot = self.compute_command_velocity(position_desired)
243 
244  # Modify the velocity with the obstacles information
245  # Add flacco algorithm for end effector to get cartesian velocity xc_dot
246  # xc_dot = self.end_effector_algorithm(xd_dot)
247  xc_dot = xd_dot
248 
249  # Compute the corresponding joint velocities q_dot
250  self.q_dot = self.compute_command_q_dot(xc_dot)
251  # Compute the joint velocity restrictions and apply them
252  (q_dot_min, q_dot_max) = self.body_algorithm()
253  self.apply_restrictions(q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
254  # Publish velocities
255  self.panda_controller.send_velocities(self.q_dot)
256  self.rate.sleep()
257  self.stop()
258  return 0
259 
260 
261 if __name__ == "__main__":
262 
263  obstacle_avoidance_controller = ObstacleAvoidanceController()
264  x0 = 0.6
265  y0 = 0.0
266  z0 = 0.3
267  r = 0.2
268  resolution = 0.4
269  trajectory = obstacle_avoidance_controller.get_trajectory_points_in_circle_yz_plane(r, x0, y0, z0, resolution)
270  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
271  for point in trajectory:
272  if not rospy.is_shutdown():
273  obstacle_avoidance_controller.go_to_point(point)
